• Back to overview
mcode Reference Model Version 1.0.0
shr.core

Entry Element Appointment

Documentation:

A booking of a healthcare event among patient(s), practitioner(s), related person(s) and/or device(s) for a specific date/time.

Ancestors:
  • Resource
    • DomainResource
      • Appointment
Used By:
  • Encounter

    • Field Summary

      Properties Defined Constraints Value
      ServiceCategory

      A broad categorization of the service (ordered, planned, or performed).
      DataType
      Cardinality
      ServiceCategory
      0..1
      ServiceDetails

      A service requested or performed. Additional details and instructions about the service requested or performed. For example, and order for a urinary catheter may have an order detail for an external or indwelling catheter, or an order for a bandage may require additional instructions specifying how the bandage should be applied.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      ServiceDetails
      0..*
      Specialty

      The specialty of a practitioner who (should, will, or did) perform a service.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      Specialty
      0..*

      The explanation or justification for the current item or action, as a code. Reason is a string or CodeableConcept in DSTU2 but in later versions only a CodeableConcept.

      TimePeriod

      A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year. If the start date/time is missing, the start of the period is not known. If the end date/time is missing, it means that the period is ongoing.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      TimePeriod
      0..1
      ExpectedPerformanceTime

      When an action should be done. If the action is a series or recurs (e.g. daily blood sugar testing in the morning) then a Timing can be used to describe the periodicity.
